headline: Canadian grocery store shames customers for plastic bag use

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: Bernie looks crazy, but he always did. But he looks like a tired crazy right now. And Joe Biden, he looks like he's just exhausted. I don't know what happened to him, but he is exhausted. And he doesn't do any work. He's not working.

utterances.speaker: JOSE DIAZ-BALART, AMERICAN JOURNALIST
utterances.sentences: A Quinnipiac poll out in Florida says that Sanders, Biden, Warren, Buttigieg right now would beat you.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I know but Buttigieg, you do believe that really? Do you believe it? They also have me losing Texas to Pocahontas. I'm not losing Texas to anybody.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: It's so much fun to read it in Spanish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Another week, another wonderful learning experience. First, the campaign kickoff in Orlando -- that's in Florida -- where we learned what would happen if Trump deleted one e-mail.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: If I deleted one e-mail, like a love note to Melania, it's the electric chair for Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know that feeling. We also learned some history, like does anyone have a higher percentage than your favorite President Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: One person has a higher percentage than you have favorite President Donald Trump. Do you know who that President is? He has got a higher percentage than me and it's devastating. His name is George Washington.   George is at 100 percent, and there's no way I'm going to get there no matter what I tell you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh man, and what about the wall? Is it moving along?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: The wall is moving along. It's moving along rapidly. It's beautiful. I changed the design. It's stronger, bigger, and better and cheaper. You know, sometimes when they don't give you the money, you have to make it cheaper.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true. But do we have to pay?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You pay for the very distinct privilege of not having to pay, but you had to pay a lot. Now, you don't have to pay any more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have no idea what that meant. But I asked, do you need a magic wand?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: You need a magic wand to bring back manufacturing? Well, we'll tell Sleepy Joe that we found the magic wand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, at least he has a lot of brilliant talented campaign people.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We have a lot of brilliant talent campaign people, they cost a fortune and they never give me any ideas. I'm only kidding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, he's not kidding. It makes you wonder what country you're in.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: MAGA. MAGA country. We are in MAGA country, that I can tell you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That I can tell you. Now as you know, MAGA is no longer the motto. It's now Keep America Great or KAG, which sounds like a Finnish death metal group, and it is a departure.  See, the first motto, MAGA said "Hey, it's time for a change." The new one says, "Let's preserve what we've changed." I can't wait to see the slogan for his third term.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anyway, that's impossible people. It's impossible, but as he throws his first political tailgate, "The Orlando Sentinel," a paper pulled a first, too. An anti-endorsement of Trump even before the Dems have a nominee, meaning they hate Trump so much the Dems could nominate a desiccated zombie raccoon, and they'd go with a dedicated zombie raccoon. But enough about Bernie Sanders.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I still think it's a little infantile, much like CNN who after being insulted at the rally actually shut their coverage down, proving how emotional they really are. I'm surprised they didn't shout, "I hate all of you," then run upstairs and slammed their door and fling themselves on the bed sobbing into a cloth pillow. But at least they provided coverage for some creepy stuff.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, D-N.Y.
utterances.sentences: The academic definition of concentration camps are targeting a community and putting them in detention camps without a trial. And that's what the Trump administration is doing.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Is she right in defining concentration camps? Yes, but do they have a feeling of usage, stained with what happened with the Nazis and the genocide of the Jews? Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So as one side celebrates a country, the other floats in an impervious, idiotic bubble, insulting Holocaust victims and then justifying with some lame semantics. Again, the contrast. This is Trump --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Crazy group. And this is his critics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now I'm bad at predicting things, but I know this, the side that's having the most fun usually wins. On the Republican side, it's fun; on the Democrats, it's a funk -- a deep dark, smelly bottom of the laundry hamper funk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know where the socks have already gone stiff. Every candidate staking out the gloomiest vision for our country. So thank heavens, Trump will be live tweeting the debates. How awesome is that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: People won't be watching the debates. They'll be watching him watching the debates. The Democrats should be thrilled over this. Fact is, if there's one person who can make Amy Klobuchar or Eric Swalwell, interesting, it's not Amy Klobuchar or Eric Swalwell. It's Trump and his tweet machine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a special time. But it's hard to see how special it really is when you're in it. It's one of those times that can only be revealed when you're looking back at it decades from now. Lucky for you, I took my time machine to the future and found the perfect product.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION PERSONALITY
utterances.sentences: Hi. I'm Tom Shillue. You know me as the guy whose face makes you feel safe, but you forget in just a few minutes. Well, I'm thrilled to share with you a collection like no other.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I won't talk about Jeb Bush, I will not say -- I will not say he is low energy. I will not say it. I will not say it.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Now, for the first time ever, all the unforgettable Trump hits are together in one must-have collection, Star Unicorn Entertainment and Greg Life presents "The Best of Trump."

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We will build the wall. And who is going to pay for the wall?

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Mexico.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Before we go any further, I'd like to introduce my co-host, Kat, Timpf.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NATION PERSONALITY
utterances.sentences: Hello, you might recognize me from such films as "Titanic 17: Jack's Revenge." But today, I'm excited to look back on the voice that defined an era.

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, FORMER FIRST LADY
utterances.sentences: Donald supported the invasion of Iraq.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Wrong.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.sentences: That is absolute --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Wrong.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.sentences: Proved over and over again.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Wrong.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.sentences: He actually --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: The "Best of Trump" is great for when you want to have friends over.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Or if like me, you have no friends but want to relive the old days of the campaign.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am officially running for President of the United States. And we are going to make our country great again.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: This collection brings back so many great memories, like before my wife left me for Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's right, Tom, and with more than 47,000 hours of content, you'll be transported back to all the most iconic moments. I'm cold.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think you should let me run the country. You run CNN, and if you did it well, your ratings would be much better.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN CHIEF WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: All right, let me ask you -- if I may ask you one more question.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Okay, that's enough.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Before, if you wanted this much Trump, you'd have to watch the news 24/7 and ignore your family completely.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Don't I know it, Kat. My son still won't talk to me. But now I can get the greatest Trump moments all in one place. Whenever I want, I can see classics like, "Get him out of here."

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: All right. Get him out of here, please. Get him out. Out. Out. Go home to mommy.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: How was your nap, Kat?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It was great, Tom.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: You know, it seems like every clip in this set tells a great story.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's right. Who could forget, bing, bing, bong, bong, bing, bing, bing?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Bing, bing, bong, bong, bing, bing, bing -- you know what that is.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You won't find this collection on CNN.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: You're telling me? You remember, "Where's Nick?"

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Nick, where are you Nick? Stand up. Get up here, Nick.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: So order Trump Hits today. Call anytime within the next four years and you'll receive a limited edition lock of the President's hair in a tiny glass bottle for no additional charge. Trump Hits. Rated M for MAGA.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. He has got more guts than a belly flop contest. Former U.S. Marines bomb technician Staff Sergeant Joey Jones.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He has made more jaws drop than a sexy orthodontist, his comedy special, "I Got the House" is now streaming everywhere, Jim Florentine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She is quick with a quip, her glasses are thick, but they're part of her shtick. Host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Katherine Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is a shoplifter, meaning he can actually lift an entire shop. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So Joey, what do you make of the campaign kickoff? JOHNNY "JOEY" JONES, FORMER U.S. MARINES BOMB TECHNICIAN: Well, I loved the video by the way and then the second little cat jumping, that's me getting on an escalator every day of my life.  GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: Okay, stop, stop, listen.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, we need to let everyone know.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: If anyone jokes about his legs, he is cool with it. Be cool with it with him, just like this.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I am a bit of a one-trick pony over here. Listen, if I ever read arguing with Holocaust survivors over the definition of concentration camps, if I ever reached that level of my political career, put you know put a fork in me, I'm done. That level of stupidity doesn't have any place in American politics which leads me to believe the conspiracy theory that she is an actress that's been hired by the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I don't know. Where do you come off arguing that this -- anyway?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So I'd stop there.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay. Jim?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I don't want to get mad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jim, what did you make of the week so far?

utterances.speaker: JIM FLORENTINE, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: I thought he was great. I mean a lot -- he got a lot of criticism because he was complaining in the first hour. But, you know, he has every right to complain. I mean, they've been on him -- the Democrats while work with him. You know, the Mueller report was hanging over his head all the time. The media is against him.  The media is almost like a nagging wife. They just pick at him. They look at any little thing -- look at the way he yawned. Could you believe it? You know? So just --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Spoken just like a man who just got divorced.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. That's why in my comedy specials, I got the house.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Did you get the house?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I did get the house, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is it a nice house?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, congratulations.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: Yes, just call me PD Prenup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: But anyway, so it was good. You know, just that he got anything done in the first two and a half years is amazing with all of that. I mean, the guy is an animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kat? I kind of want you to do the movie that you said you were in, which is "Titanic 14"?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Seventeen. Jack's Revenge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Seventeen: Jack's Revenge. And I'm excited for that in your future.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I've been writing it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And you make it -- you make an excellent elderly Kat Timpf.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: So I want to go back to what you were talking about, about AOC and her concentration camp's thing. That was so stupid. I was trying to think of what it was like. So I wrote a bunch of analogies, but I couldn't decide which one I liked best. So I'm just going to say them all. Okay. That's like saying having a cold is like having cancer. That's like saying your phone dying is like your mom dying. That's like saying that wearing a tie that's too tight is like being beheaded. That's like saying that eating hot soup and having it burn your mouth is like being burned alive while eating hot soup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And that's like saying breaking a fingernail is as bad as having a nail in your finger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I guess it's hard to pick from those. It's hard to pick.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't know which -- I didn't know which one to pick. So they all -- they all made the air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I think that's accurate, because there were no one sentence to describe the moronic-ness of what she said.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The only thing left is like that's the same thing as saying somebody breaks into your house trips and falls and breaks their neck and you go to jail for murder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because that's kind of the same thing.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know, Trump had a big week, you know, he kicked it off. And we didn't see the Democrats again, like it was -- once he got on the news, the only thing we had going on was they are really mad at Joe Biden for telling how it is.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Cory Booker was mad at Joe because Joe told the truth of something that actually happened in historic event, not something that you made up on Twitter. Or, you know, Cory Booker is hilarious to me as one brother to another. I'm all for civil rights and fighting for, you know, our stuff. But his claim to fame to go after job Joe Biden is he wanted to -- he led the legislation to let everybody know that lynch mob is a crime, it is officially a crime. Like we didn't already know that if you form a lynch mob, you're going to jail. See you in court.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way, you are prefacing our next segment, which is we are going to talk about that. All right, you want a sorry from Joe Biden, well, you're not going to get one. That's next.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: And now “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents, the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is a Civil War over being civil. At a fundraiser this week, Joe Biden was talking about the importance of working together even with people you disagree with, like bigots who were also Democrats because that's what you did back then. That didn't go over well.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: To coddle the reputations of segregationists, of people who, if they had their way I would literally not be standing here as a member of the United States Senate is I think -- it's just -- it's misinformed. And it's wrong.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I know that I was raised to speak truth to power and that I should never apologize for doing that, and Vice President Biden shouldn't need this lesson.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Spartacus. Of course the media smells blood and asked Biden if he would apologize?

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Are you going to apologize like Cory Booker has called for?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Apologize for what?

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.sentences: Cory Booker has called for it.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.sentences: Cory should apologize. He knows better. There is not a racist bone in my body. I've been involved in civil rights my whole career, period, period, period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's not how you do it. It's this way.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But then Congressman John Lewis, a civil rights legend vouched for Biden.

utterances.speaker: REP. JOHN LEWIS, D-GA
utterances.sentences: I don't think the remarks were offensive, but during the height of the Civil Rights Movement, we worked with people. You get to know people that were members of the Klan, people who opposed them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go, now, do the other candidates really think Biden is a racist? Probably not. Are they trying to knock Biden out of the top spot? Of course. Did they actually get the point Biden was making about working together is more effective than shunning? Yes, but they don't care. Will someone bring this up on the debate stage next week? We'll see. Should I stop asking and answering my own questions? Yes.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Tyrus, you were talking about this at the end. So let's continue. What do you -- do you feel any sympathy for Joe?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, there's no reason feel sympathy for him. He was telling them something that actually happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: There was a time in this country that we had to work with certain individuals who prefer me serving drinks and not being on camera. That's a part of our history. It's ugly or whatever. His whole point was, he worked for common good and he passed legislation to stop those type of beliefs because he had to work with them. Find a way. So people who are legit Joe Crow t-shirt rocking racists who are sitting on the Senate proud to stick it out, he can work with them. And they were the exact opposite of everything that he believed in and his record speaks for itself in terms of that type of stuff. Joe has been a good dude when it comes to respecting different races and stuff. He could say his ability to work with --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Except for Indians at 7/11.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But that's a different story.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes. It is a different story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The point is, he can work with those people in those type of situations and we live in a world today that nobody can work together and it's not even that -- there's not -- there's no issue between the two sides that something as polarizing as civil rights was, and they found a way, but we can't find a way and that's pathetic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. What do you make of this Jim?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jim, they're going to just eat him alive, aren't they?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: They are. The mainstream media is starting to turn on him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: And it's only a matter of time. Now, they are just going on attacking. Remember they made that pledge, all of the Democrats don't attack each other?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: And now -- what was that? Three weeks ago? And now, they are just at each other. I love it that they're eating their own. And no, Joe Biden, he is just -- he doesn't have it. I think he would have probably maybe won in 2016. Now, he looks old. He is flip flopping. He is fumbling his sentence. He's almost like Willie Mays when he played for the Mets.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: You know what I mean? It's just like, that's it. You know, Joe Namath when he played for the Rams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: Yes, he is not in his prime anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Joe Namath. No, Joe Montana when he went to Kansas City.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.sentences: When he played the Chiefs, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I did a sports analogy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kat, do you see him making it to the nomination?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I don't know. I'm not a fortune teller. I just think it's so interesting that they are attacking each other so much, especially when people like Bill de Blasio attack him. Who is that for? Right? Like it's not because you know, it's not going to help him win the nomination. It's probably just going to help Trump eventually win, because they're going to have attacked each other. It's like, if you're a boxer -- I'm going to do a sports analogy, too, okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It's like if you're a boxer, and you have to box like 20 something people before getting to your final match and the other dude has just been chilling, it's going to be a lot harder and that's exactly what they're doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is an interesting boxing metaphor, Joey. Last words to you, thoughts?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: I kind of see this a little different? I mean, Biden would have the opportunity to be the Trump of the Democrats, right? He is like, apologize for what? I'm not sorry. I'm already there. And the problem is, he's been around for too long, right? So he is too much because he ends it with, you know, the good old boy, his come on, man. It's kind of like Trump's huge, you know, and -- but that's not going to get it. I think that Democrats democrating Democrats with the fake outrage is exactly what we're seeing. They're turning it on their own and it exposes it because Trump's got the fans for it. Biden doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know what? I've said this a million times. All Joe is getting is what he's done to other people. He did this to Trump, he did this the Mitt Romney when he said Mitt Romney is going to put you all in chains, so it's kind of like, I feel bad for the guy but at the same time, it's like you got in bed with the smear machine and now the smear machine is screwing you. All right, up next, are cell phones turning us into Satan? No, but that's a pretty good tease, right?

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie in New York. Eleven people are dead after a skydiving plane crashes shortly after takeoff in Hawaii. It happened near Dillingham Airfield on the North Shore of Oahu. An eyewitness as the plane was flying at a low altitude, it skimmed some trees and burst into flames near the airport's perimeter fence. There are no survivors tonight. And Federal investigators are on the scene right now trying to figure out what caused the crash. President Trump is delaying immigration raids for two weeks. That's after a telephone call from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi requesting that delay. On Sunday, I.C.E. agents we're going to start to arrest and deport immigrant families in 10 cities. The plan was criticized as heartless by immigration activists and the cities mayors. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can being on the horn make you horny? Literally, horny? A headline in "The Washington Post" scared the crap out of us this week, quote, "Horns are growing on young people skulls and phone use is to blame, research suggests." "Newsweek" called them spikes. Spikes growing from our skulls caused by the forward tilt of the head when we look at our phones. It shifts the weight in your muscles and your spine in your skull and it causes a spiky bone spur. Just a bone spur, not really spikes or horns. Those headlines were kind of misleading. I was picturing horns, weren't you? Like devil horns maybe? Or ram horns? Yes. Maybe a French horn? Yes. How do you like that growing out of your skull? But perhaps this horn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I really think the music makes it pleasurable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's why I've been playing in my spa. All right, Jim, I don't know what I meant there. This study could be full of crap because "Reason" magazine is debunking. It said it has more to do with posture, but I don't care that it's false. Because I like this story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She is quick with a quip, her glasses are thick, but they're part of her shtick. Host of "Sincerely, Kat" on Fox Nation, Katherine Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is a shoplifter, meaning he can actually lift an entire shop. My massive sidekick and host of "Nuff Said" on Fox Nation, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So Joey, what do you make of the campaign kickoff? JOHNNY "JOEY" JONES, FORMER U.S. MARINES BOMB TECHNICIAN: Well, I loved the video by the way and then the second little cat jumping, that's me getting on an escalator every day of my life. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, CONTRIBUTOR: Okay, stop, stop, listen.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, we need to let everyone know.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: If anyone jokes about his legs, he is cool with it. Be cool with it with him, just like this.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I am a bit of a one-trick pony over here. Listen, if I ever read arguing with Holocaust survivors over the definition of concentration camps, if I ever reached that level of my political career, put you know put a fork in me, I'm done. That level of stupidity doesn't have any place in American politics which leads me to believe the conspiracy theory that she is an actress that's been hired by the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Where do you come off arguing that this -- anyway?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So I'd stop there.

utterances.speaker: JONES

utterances.utterance: Okay. Jim?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I don't want to get mad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: JIM FLORENTINE, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: I thought he was great. I mean a lot -- he got a lot of criticism because he was complaining in the first hour. But, you know, he has every right to complain. I mean, they've been on him -- the Democrats while work with him. You know, the Mueller report was hanging over his head all the time. The media is against him. The media is almost like a nagging wife. They just pick at him. They look at any little thing -- look at the way he yawned. Could you believe it? You know? So just --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Spoken just like a man who just got divorced.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. That's why in my comedy specials, I got the house.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Did you get the house?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did get the house, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it a nice house?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, congratulations.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Yes, just call me PD Prenup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: But anyway, so it was good. You know, just that he got anything done in the first two and a half years is amazing with all of that. I mean, the guy is an animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: So I want to go back to what you were talking about, about AOC and her concentration camp's thing. That was so stupid. I was trying to think of what it was like. So I wrote a bunch of analogies, but I couldn't decide which one I liked best. So I'm just going to say them all. Okay. That's like saying having a cold is like having cancer. That's like saying your phone dying is like your mom dying. That's like saying that wearing a tie that's too tight is like being beheaded. That's like saying that eating hot soup and having it burn your mouth is like being burned alive while eating hot soup.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

utterances.speaker: TIMPF

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Cory Booker was mad at Joe because Joe told the truth of something that actually happened in historic event, not something that you made up on Twitter. Or, you know, Cory Booker is hilarious to me as one brother to another. I'm all for civil rights and fighting for, you know, our stuff. But his claim to fame to go after job Joe Biden is he wanted to -- he led the legislation to let everybody know that lynch mob is a crime, it is officially a crime. Like we didn't already know that if you form a lynch mob, you're going to jail. See you in court.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, you are prefacing our next segment, which is we are going to talk about that. All right, you want a sorry from Joe Biden, well, you're not going to get one. That's next.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: And now “The Greg Gutfeld Show” presents, the 2020 CAN'T-idates.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is a Civil War over being civil. At a fundraiser this week, Joe Biden was talking about the importance of working together even with people you disagree with, like bigots who were also Democrats because that's what you did back then. That didn't go over well.

utterances.utterance: To coddle the reputations of segregationists, of people who, if they had their way I would literally not be standing here as a member of the United States Senate is I think -- it's just -- it's misinformed. And it's wrong.

utterances.speaker: SEN. CORY BOOKER, D-N.J., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I know that I was raised to speak truth to power and that I should never apologize for doing that, and Vice President Biden shouldn't need this lesson.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Spartacus. Of course the media smells blood and asked Biden if he would apologize?

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.utterance: Are you going to apologize like Cory Booker has called for?

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Apologize for what?

utterances.speaker: QUESTION
utterances.utterance: Cory Booker has called for it.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Cory should apologize. He knows better. There is not a racist bone in my body. I've been involved in civil rights my whole career, period, period, period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's not how you do it. It's this way.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But then Congressman John Lewis, a civil rights legend vouched for Biden.

utterances.speaker: REP. JOHN LEWIS, D-GA
utterances.utterance: I don't think the remarks were offensive, but during the height of the Civil Rights Movement, we worked with people. You get to know people that were members of the Klan, people who opposed them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go, now, do the other candidates really think Biden is a racist? Probably not. Are they trying to knock Biden out of the top spot? Of course. Did they actually get the point Biden was making about working together is more effective than shunning? Yes, but they don't care. Will someone bring this up on the debate stage next week? We'll see. Should I stop asking and answering my own questions? Yes.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.utterance: Tyrus, you were talking about this at the end. So let's continue. What do you -- do you feel any sympathy for Joe?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH

It's ugly or whatever. His whole point was, he worked for common good and he passed legislation to stop those type of beliefs because he had to work with them. Find a way. So people who are legit Joe Crow t-shirt rocking racists who are sitting on the Senate proud to stick it out, he can work with them. And they were the exact opposite of everything that he believed in and his record speaks for itself in terms of that type of stuff. Joe has been a good dude when it comes to respecting different races and stuff. He could say his ability to work with --

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.utterance: But that's a different story.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes. It is a different story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: The point is, he can work with those people in those type of situations and we live in a world today that nobody can work together and it's not even that -- there's not -- there's no issue between the two sides that something as polarizing as civil rights was, and they found a way, but we can't find a way and that's pathetic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. What do you make of this Jim?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jim, they're going to just eat him alive, aren't they?

utterances.utterance: They are. The mainstream media is starting to turn on him.

utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: And now -- what was that? Three weeks ago? And now, they are just at each other. I love it that they're eating their own. And no, Joe Biden, he is just -- he doesn't have it. I think he would have probably maybe won in 2016. Now, he looks old. He is flip flopping. He is fumbling his sentence. He's almost like Willie Mays when he played for the Mets.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: You know what I mean? It's just like, that's it. You know, Joe Namath when he played for the Rams.

I just think it's so interesting that they are attacking each other so much, especially when people like Bill de Blasio attack him. Who is that for? Right? Like it's not because you know, it's not going to help him win the nomination. It's probably just going to help Trump eventually win, because they're going to have attacked each other. It's like, if you're a boxer -- I'm going to do a sports analogy, too, okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It's like if you're a boxer, and you have to box like 20 something people before getting to your final match and the other dude has just been chilling, it's going to be a lot harder and that's exactly what they're doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is an interesting boxing metaphor, Joey. Last words to you, thoughts?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I kind of see this a little different? I mean, Biden would have the opportunity to be the Trump of the Democrats, right? He is like, apologize for what? I'm not sorry. I'm already there. And the problem is, he's been around for too long, right? So he is too much because he ends it with, you know, the good old boy, his come on, man. It's kind of like Trump's huge, you know, and -- but that's not going to get it. I think that Democrats democrating Democrats with the fake outrage is exactly what we're seeing. They're turning it on their own and it exposes it because Trump's got the fans for it. Biden doesn't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know what? I've said this a million times. All Joe is getting is what he's done to other people. He did this to Trump, he did this the Mitt Romney when he said Mitt Romney is going to put you all in chains, so it's kind of like, I feel bad for the guy but at the same time, it's like you got in bed with the smear machine and now the smear machine is screwing you. All right, up next, are cell phones turning us into Satan? No, but that's a pretty good tease, right?

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie in New York. Eleven people are dead after a skydiving plane crashes shortly after takeoff in Hawaii. It happened near Dillingham Airfield on the North Shore of Oahu. An eyewitness as the plane was flying at a low altitude, it skimmed some trees and burst into flames near the airport's perimeter fence. There are no survivors tonight. And Federal investigators are on the scene right now trying to figure out what caused the crash. President Trump is delaying immigration raids for two weeks. That's after a telephone call from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi requesting that delay. On Sunday, I.C.E. agents we're going to start to arrest and deport immigrant families in 10 cities. The plan was criticized as heartless by immigration activists and the cities mayors. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.”

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can being on the horn make you horny? Literally, horny? A headline in "The Washington Post" scared the crap out of us this week, quote, "Horns are growing on young people skulls and phone use is to blame, research suggests." "Newsweek" called them spikes. Spikes growing from our skulls caused by the forward tilt of the head when we look at our phones. It shifts the weight in your muscles and your spine in your skull and it causes a spiky bone spur. Just a bone spur, not really spikes or horns. Those headlines were kind of misleading. I was picturing horns, weren't you? Like devil horns maybe? Or ram horns? Yes. Maybe a French horn? Yes. How do you like that growing out of your skull? But perhaps this horn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I really think the music makes it pleasurable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's why I've been playing in my spa. All right, Jim, I don't know what I meant there. This study could be full of crap because "Reason" magazine is debunking. It said it has more to do with posture, but I don't care that it's false. Because I like this story.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: I like it, too. I'm into heavy metal music, so that's always the devil's music. So I did want horns for years. You know, so if I get - - it's kind of nerdy though that I'm going to get it from my iPhone 8 horn. I'd much rather get it from my lust, greed and gluttony lifestyle. That's way cooler.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Kat. This is just one effect of technology. If you go down the line, social media is turning us into monsters, right? We're less human. Video games are basically killing off sports, which I'm for actually, and pornography is offering you the ability to satisfy your needs without the messiness of human contact. We're just good -- we're turning into cyborgs.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: That's okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, I saw this horn story and I should have been concerned seeing as I stare at my phone, literally all day long. And I don't know I probably have the horns. If they're real, I definitely have them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And I don't care because what else am I supposed to look at? The world around me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Barf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And you can't see your own horns.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't understand the downside of being on your phone all the time because phones are much more interesting than most people. Except, except for maybe one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No one downside.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It would make me very easy to kidnap, like I wouldn't even realize it was happening. I would look up like three days later. I'd be like, "Wait, whose dungeon is this?" Surprised that that happened, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's good to know for potential kidnappers?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Bring me to your dungeons. I won't even notice. I'd probably would be boring to kidnap though because I just feel like playing "Words with Friends" the whole time.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Just keep texting her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Keep texting her. Who is this? I want to know who you are. You could carry her away and it would be great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, Joey, would you mind having some horns?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Listen, when I read this headline, I'm like, when did the Westborough Baptist Church started doing scientific studies? Right? It will give you horns, you know. But listen, humans are the only ones that adapt our environment to us, rather than evolve to it, right? We wear jackets instead of real fur. It's proven that we're losing our pinky toes because we wear shoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank God for that.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I'm way ahead of you on that one, by the way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My pinky toe is just stupid. You look at your pinky toe, and it's like why?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Mine is a molded out of rubber and connected to all the others.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I forgot.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You laugh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm complaining to Joey.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Shame on you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That I don't like my pinky toe.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, my pinky toe, oh.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Boo that man.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: So when I saw this, I thought they meant like having your phone up there was causing a bone spur, but it's looking down. It's like how did people read books for 2000 years? Did they hold them up here? Like I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think that this is not entirely true, Tyrus. However the greater idea that the human -- the human mind or the human body is in communion with technology, we're actually -- we're producing offspring that is a commingling of electronic, of like computers and humans.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did not drop acid.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Okay. Listen, I love a good science story, and I'm all for some cool evolution, but this don't even make sense. If you're leaning forward all the times, shouldn't the horn come out here to be like a kickstand to keep your head up, like it's in the back, it's only pushing it this way and if your little theory would come out, wouldn't it be like our chins just become like a phone holder? Like that would be like, wow our chins are longer so we can -- you know, so Kat can have more free time with her other hand to drink while she texts. Like, this type of stuff sounds great, but this is the problem with media today. It's all about the headline. The hell with the facts of the story. One kid's got bad posture and apparently some stuff growing out the back of his neck and the best excuse the parents could come up with was, "Oh, it's from his phone."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, this sounds like something my mom would have used to ground me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's that thing -- it's like -- you know, it's when they always would tell you that you would go blind, right? I mean when you --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I didn't even get to finish the line. All right, up next, would an embarrassing slogan on a plastic bag get you to stop using them? Yes, me neither. After that, Joe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These stupid nags want your plastic bags. A grocery store in Vancouver -- they have them there -- has introduced plastic bags with embarrassing logos to shame customers into bringing their own reusable ones. The bags make it look like the items come from places like The Colon Care Co-Op and Dr. Toes Wart Ointment wholesale and Into The Weird Adult Video Emporium. These are popular. So if these are supposed to be embarrassing. Colin Care, ointment and porn? That's my Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Especially in the summer with the extra hours. Now, stores in Vancouver are required by law to come up with plans to reduce plastic bags. But people think these bags are funny. So they want to use them. So here's what you've got to do Vancouver, just say what's actually inside the bag and you're good to go. For example, cheap wine to make the pain go away until your divorce is finalized. She is taking me for everything. Or assorted lunch meats for my stupid brats, so they will eat at school, they make my life hell, but I still have got to feed them. A birthday card for someone at work that I can't stand. He smells like vinegar and he never zips his fly to the top. It's almost always three quarters the way but it's never all the way up. Stuff for the itching and the burning. Mostly the itching, but sometimes it's for the burning, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Kat, would these bags shame you?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No. No. I want all of these bags. Who wants a bag that just says CVS? You know, I thrive and survive on attention.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: And that can be very exhausting. Not only for me, but for all of those around me. It puts a strain on the relationships. And so you're telling me if I go to Vancouver and I don't bring a bag, I don't actually have to do anything for attention? I can just carry it around and people will look at me? I never have to eat soup on Instagram Live again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jim, I like these bags because it's kind of like if you're sitting on a bus. It's way to keep somebody away from you. Right?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: That's a good idea. Look, I would collect them like baseball cards. I would want every one of them. I would stand outside the supermarket. I'm like, look, I've got two, I got herpes bags. I'm missing the Bestiality rules bag. Can we switch up? First of all, if you want to get rid of bags, why does every cashier put one item in each bag?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That is so true. I end up like with 12 bags and I bought 11 items, Tyrus?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I believe that. You know, we're missing the point here. This is more of these stores and these companies that are so full of crap when it comes to they care about the environment. They're trying to turn a buck. They're trying to make you buy these stupid reusable bags that you keep having to buy. If they cared so much about the environment, they wouldn't have plastic bags there. But they don't do that. They are trying to turn a buck.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everything in their stores, Joey --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Two ways they get you. Do you want to donate to such and such thing? And if you say no, everyone looks at you because the button beeps louder if you say no. You notice that if you don't donate. Maybe I don't feel like building camp this year, I already did the other day. And the thing with the bags. You want 12 bucks for a bag this big that looks horrible?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And if you don't clean the bags, Joey, the bag that you reuse, you will get salmonella because people are getting sick from the reusable bags because they aren't cleaning them, so they get -- you're like buying - - if you buy like vegetables. I don't, but --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I eat all my food raw. I've never gotten sick, so - -

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: No, not really.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: But I did kill all my own animals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You do kill your own animals. How good of you.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: That's what I got booed about last time I was on here. I love to kill animals and eat them --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everybody thinks that the food at the store wasn't killed.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. They grew that way in plastic. But the thing about these bags and it's the perfect example of the difference between Canada and the United States and so, some Canadian store you know as nice as they could be came up with these and what they underestimated were the thousands of Americans who will fly a thousand miles putting carbon into the atmosphere to do an Instagram story holding one of these bags in Vancouver. And so, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Think about these. What about all of these aging celebrities with plastic surgery? Will they have to have little insulting sayings on their face? I don't even know what it means.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, this surgery in itself is insulting when the human duck walks up to you and go, "Remember me?" And you're like, "Jesus. Stop."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. It's true. Up next. OJ is Twitter and other things I never thought I'd hear myself say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OJ is on Twitter, and he is sounding bitter. OJ Simpson who is famous for something besides football, launched his Twitter account this week with a pretty ominous message after a very friendly greeting, "Hey, Twitter world."

utterances.speaker: OJ SIMPSON, FORMER NFL PLAYER
utterances.utterance: Hey, Twitter world, this is yours truly now coming soon to Twitter, you'll get to read all my thoughts and opinions on just about everything. Hey, Twitter world. You know, for years, people have been able to say what everybody wanted to say about me with no accountability. But now I get to challenge a lot of that BS and set the record straight. This should be a lot of fun. I've got a little getting even to do. So God bless.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And God is like, "Don't drag me into this, OJ." So OJ has already gotten over 700,000 followers, which is weird, given the take offense at everything times we're living in now, especially on Twitter. You think people would see and accuse double murderer there and close out their account in protest. There's so many other worthwhile things to do with your time. I'd rather be doing this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that did not go over well. What a mess. All right, Jim. I think this is a bad idea for him because, you know, he is a short temper and you go on and you know, social media is a more concentrated version of real life hostilities. I don't think his short fuse and Twitter is a good mix.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: No, and when he said, I've got a little even to get you know, some people, I immediately deleted all my OJ jokes on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He has the time now. He is out.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Yes, he does. And then he said -- he goes, I want to set the record straight. Nothing about the murders, about setting that record straight. He just said, listen, I didn't sleep with Kris Jenner.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that was it. That's what bothered me.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: That's what bothered him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what he --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Not the double murder.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not the double murder.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: That's a rumor that you should keep floating out there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: Christian or the prime? You know what I mean? I just I wouldn't even acknowledge that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But that bothered him.

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: That bothered him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That bothered him. Tyrus, what do you make of this? Should this drive people off Twitter?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Can I get a close up?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: OJ, go away. You went to jail for 20 years for taking your own stuff back. You didn't get the hint? You testified then, how'd that work out? Don't talk. Is there any of his lawyers left that are still alive that could text him and say, "Don't talk." Go away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Bye.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know, man. You know, Joey --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is going to -- people are going to love tweeting at him just to get him mad.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's already there. I mean, don't go look at the comments under all of his tweets because it's a rabbit hole that you'll go down for a long time. But what really devastates me about this is that Twitter is 20 years too late. It's like what if we had Twitter when he was in that Bronco? "Hey, Twitter world, that ain't me in the Bronco." "Hey, Twitter world. I'm not driving, I'm just riding along here right now." You know it's like -- it is like set the record straight. The legal record is that he is innocent. So what is the setting it straight to?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, good point.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: So, it's like, you know, dude, take your wins where you have them, I guess. I don't know, but --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Kat, what if he starts following you?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't know, Greg. I ate a lot of rice pudding today. I mean, like a lot of rice pudding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who does that?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, apparently, me -- I'm talking multiple servings of rice pudding to the point where it didn't just make me feel bad physically, it made me feel bad emotionally. Like, like really, Kat, you're going to eat all that rice pudding? Like how did you think that you were going to feel good after that? And then I didn't really feel like you know -- I ate so much pudding, I didn't even feel like coming out here. I'm like, how were these people going to have -- you know, care what I have to say when I can't control myself around rice pudding. You know who doesn't feel that way?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: OJ.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I was trying to figure out where this was going to come? How she was going to tie that that rice pudding.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It was an alarming amount of rice pudding. And I'm having a hard time thinking about anything else. So the rice pudding was going to come into the show at some point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, I'm glad it was in the OJ segment.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Well juice does go with rice puddings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Don't forget -- don't forget I'm bringing the the "Gutfeld Monologues Live" to the Jersey Shore next month, Saturday, July 20th, Asbury Park, New Jersey. Get your tickets. Go to ggutfeld. com. Stay right there. "Final Thoughts," I hope, next.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: "Final Thoughts." It's the last thought. That's why it's called the "Final Thoughts." Okay?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Joey? Anything?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. I run a veterans transition program -- a camp. It's a week-long at Camp Southern Ground. So if you're a post 9/11 veteran and you would like to go through a week with me and learn how to transition out of the military, go find a job or be happy, campsouthernground.org.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's great. Thank you. And Jimmy?

utterances.speaker: FLORENTINE
utterances.utterance: I'll be in Dallas, Texas next week at Hyena's Comedy Club and this fall, I'll be in a Creeps with Kids comedy tour with a bunch of other comics.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hyenas because they laugh. All right, Kat, what have you got?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Thursday, June 27 at Carolines on Broadway in New York City. Tyrus and me, are going to be there. We're doing a live show. It's going to be fun. Please come. Also, it really was so much rice pudding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, you and Tyrus together. You've got to go. All right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Get tickets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Get tickets. All right. Thanks, Joey. Thanks, Jim, Kat, Tyrus. Studio audience. I am Greg Gutfeld, I love you, America.
